pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:0.5: 80. The training rule on leaving without giving consent
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.2: the Sangha had assembled on some business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.3: The monks from the group of six were busy making robes and so they gave their consent to one among them.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.4: When the Sangha was ready to do the legal procedure for which it had assembled, it set forth the motion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.5: That monk from the group of six thought,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.6: “This is just how they do legal procedures against us one by one, but against whom will you do this one?” and without giving his consent, he got up from his seat and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.8: “How can that monk get up from his seat and leave without giving his consent, when the Sangha is in the process of deliberating?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.9: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.12: “… Foolish man, how can you get up from your seat and leave without giving your consent, when the Sangha is in the process of deliberating?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.15: ‘When the Sangha is in the process of deliberating, if a monk gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.6: when the topic has been announced but the deliberation is not yet concluded, or when the motion has been set forth, or when the announcement is still under way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.7: Gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.8: if he leaves, thinking, “How may this legal procedure be disturbed?” or “What can be done so that the assembly is incomplete?” or “What can be done so that it isn’t done?” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.9: If he is in the process of going beyond arm’s reach of the gathering, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.10: When he has gone beyond arm’s reach, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as legitimate, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as illegitimate, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.2: if he leaves because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.3: if he leaves because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.4: if he leaves because he thinks the procedure will be illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done to one who is not deserving a legal procedure;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.5: if he leaves because he is sick;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.6: if he leaves because there is something to be done for someone who is sick;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.7: if he leaves because he needs to relieve himself;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.8: if he leaves with the intention to return, and not because he wants to invalidate the procedure;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.11: The tenth rule, the training rule on leaving without giving consent, is finished.
